Power Rangers Movie](/wiki/Turbo:_A_Power_Rangers_Movie "Turbo: A Power
Rangers Movie"). For the fan film, see [Power/Rangers](/wiki/Power/Rangers
"Power/Rangers").

_**Saban 's Power Rangers**_[4] (or simply _**Power Rangers**_) is a 2017
American [superhero film](/wiki/Superhero_film "Superhero film") based on the
team [of the same name](/wiki/Power_Rangers "Power Rangers"), directed by
[Dean Israelite](/wiki/Dean_Israelite "Dean Israelite") and written by [John
Gatins](/wiki/John_Gatins "John Gatins"). It is the third [_Power Rangers_
film](/wiki/Power_Rangers#Feature_films "Power Rangers"), and is a
[reboot](/wiki/Reboot_\(fiction\) "Reboot \(fiction\)"). The film features the
main characters of the _[Mighty Morphin Power
Rangers](/wiki/Mighty_Morphin_Power_Rangers "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers")_
television series with a new cast, starring [Dacre
Montgomery](/wiki/Dacre_Montgomery "Dacre Montgomery"), [Naomi
Scott](/wiki/Naomi_Scott "Naomi Scott"), [RJ Cyler](/wiki/RJ_Cyler "RJ
Cyler"), [Becky G](/wiki/Becky_G "Becky G"), [Ludi Lin](/wiki/Ludi_Lin "Ludi
Lin"), [Bill Hader](/wiki/Bill_Hader "Bill Hader"), [Bryan
Cranston](/wiki/Bryan_Cranston "Bryan Cranston"), and [Elizabeth
Banks](/wiki/Elizabeth_Banks "Elizabeth Banks").

It is the first [blockbuster film](/wiki/Blockbuster_film "Blockbuster film")
to feature [LGBTQ](/wiki/LGBTQ "LGBTQ") and [autistic](/wiki/Autistic
"Autistic") superheroes.[5][6] Franchise creator [Haim Saban](/wiki/Haim_Saban
"Haim Saban") returned to produce the film under his [investment
firm](/wiki/Saban_Capital_Group "Saban Capital Group"). The film premiered at
the [Regency Village Theater](/wiki/Fox_Theater,_Westwood_Village "Fox
Theater, Westwood Village") in Los Angeles on March 22, 2017, and was released
in the United States on March 24, 2017. Met with mixed reviews upon release,
with criticism primarily focusing on its uneven tone and divergences from its
source material, _Power Rangers_ grossed $142 million worldwide,[3] and was
labelled a [box office disappointment](/wiki/Box_office_disappointment "Box
office disappointment").[7]

## Plot[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Plot")]

In the [Cenozoic](/wiki/Cenozoic "Cenozoic") era, six interplanetary warriors,
the Power Rangers, are tasked with protecting life on Earth and the [Zeo
Crystal](/wiki/Zeo_Crystal "Zeo Crystal"). The Green Ranger, [Rita
Repulsa](/wiki/Rita_Repulsa "Rita Repulsa"), betrays them and plans to
dominate the universe. The Red Ranger, [Zordon](/wiki/Zordon "Zordon"),
survives Rita's attack and hides five of the Rangers' power source, the Power
Coins. He orders [Alpha 5](/wiki/Alpha_5_\(Power_Rangers\) "Alpha 5 \(Power
Rangers\)") to perform [a meteor strike](/wiki/Chicxulub_impactor "Chicxulub
impactor") that kills him, the dinosaurs, and sends Rita to the bottom of the
sea, foiling her scheme.

In 21st-century [Angel Grove](/wiki/Angel_Grove "Angel Grove"), high school
football star [Jason Scott](/wiki/Jason_Lee_Scott "Jason Lee Scott") is
dismissed from the team and placed under house arrest after a failed prank. In
detention, he encounters [Billy Cranston](/wiki/Billy_Cranston "Billy
Cranston") and [Kimberly Hart](/wiki/Kimberly_Hart "Kimberly Hart"). After
defending Billy from a bully, Billy offers to deactivate Jason's ankle monitor
for help at an old gold mine that evening. Once there, Jason leaves to explore
and runs into Kimberly. Billy detonates explosives to break some rock,
attracting the attention of Jason, Kimberly and nearby students
[Trini](/wiki/Trini_Kwan "Trini Kwan") and [Zack](/wiki/Zack_Taylor "Zack
Taylor"). The five discover the Power Coins and each take one. While escaping
mine security, their car is hit by a train. The five find themselves at home
the next morning and discover that the coins have granted them superhuman
abilities. Elsewhere, Rita's body is found. Waking, she goes on a rampage,
hunting pieces of gold to raise her minion [Goldar](/wiki/Goldar "Goldar") to
find the Zeo Crystal.

The five teenagers return to the mine and discover an ancient spaceship where
they meet Alpha 5 and Zordon's consciousness. They inform the teenagers about
the Rangers history and Rita, warning that they have eleven days until Rita
has her full power, finds the Zeo Crystal, and uses it to destroy life on
Earth. The five leave the ship with no intention of returning until Zordon
pleads with Jason to convince the team.

The five return to train the next day, but they cannot morph. They spend the
next week training against simulated Putties and trying unsuccessfully to
morph. To inspire the Rangers, Alpha reveals the [Zords](/wiki/Zord "Zord").
Zack takes his Zord out for a joyride and almost kills the other Rangers when
he crashes it. This angers Jason, and they fight. While trying to separate the
two, Billy spontaneously morphs. However, when he becomes conscious of it, the
armor disappears. Angered at their lack of progress, Zordon dismisses the
group. Jason returns to the ship to confront Zordon and discovers that once
the Rangers morph, it will open the Morphing Grid and allow Zordon to restore
himself in a physical body. Feeling betrayed, Jason accuses Zordon of using
the team for his own benefit. That night, the team camp at the mine and bond
with each other.

Later that night, Rita attacks Trini and orders her to bring the Rangers to
the docks. Trini informs them about Rita and they arrive to fight, but are
quickly defeated. Rita forces Billy to reveal the location of the Zeo Crystal,
which he'd figured out, kills him, and releases the others. The Rangers take
Billy's body to the ship and ask Zordon to resurrect him. The Rangers agree
they would give their lives for each other and resolve to defeat Rita. In
doing so, they unlock the Morphing Grid. Zordon revives Billy, sacrificing
being able to restore his physical self. With the team restored and confident,
the Rangers morph into their armor.

Rita creates Goldar, raises an army of Putties, and attacks Angel Grove to
find the Zeo Crystal. The Rangers battle the Putties and head to Angel Grove
in their Zords. After the Rangers destroy the Putties, Goldar pushes the
Rangers and their Zords into a fiery pit. In the pit, the Zords combine and
form the Megazord. Rita merges with Goldar. The Rangers battle and destroy
Goldar. After refusing Jason's offer to surrender, a defiant Rita tells the
Rangers that more will come for the crystal and leaps at the Megazord only to
be slapped into space. The Rangers are praised as local heroes, and with
Rita's threats foiled, they return to their normal lives but keeping their
powers.

In a [mid-credits scene](/wiki/Post-credits_scene "Post-credits scene"), in
detention, the teacher announces that [Tommy Oliver](/wiki/Tommy_Oliver "Tommy
Oliver") will be joining them, but the desk is empty save for a green
jacket.[note 1]

## Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Cast")]

  * [Dacre Montgomery](/wiki/Dacre_Montgomery "Dacre Montgomery") as [Jason Scott / Red Ranger](/wiki/Jason_Lee_Scott "Jason Lee Scott"), the leader of the Power Rangers. Jason was the former star quarterback of Angel Grove High School's football team, however a failed prank led to a run-in with the law.[10]
  * [Naomi Scott](/wiki/Naomi_Scott "Naomi Scott") as [Kimberly Hart / Pink Ranger](/wiki/Kimberly_Hart "Kimberly Hart"), a former cheerleader. Kimberly took part in a form of [cyberbullying](/wiki/Cyberbullying "Cyberbullying") spreading a private image of her friend around school.[11][12]
  * [RJ Cyler](/wiki/RJ_Cyler "RJ Cyler") as [Billy Cranston / Blue Ranger](/wiki/Billy_Cranston "Billy Cranston"), an [autistic](/wiki/Autistic "Autistic") and intelligent loner. Billy is the classic nerd who has become a bully magnet.[5][13]
  * [Becky G](/wiki/Becky_G "Becky G") as [Trini / Yellow Ranger](/wiki/Trini_Kwan "Trini Kwan"), a girl who is questioning her [sexual orientation](/wiki/Sexual_orientation "Sexual orientation"). Her off-putting nature has led to a lack of friends.[5][6][14][15]
  * [Ludi Lin](/wiki/Ludi_Lin "Ludi Lin") as [Zack / Black Ranger](/wiki/Zack_Taylor "Zack Taylor"), a [bilingual](/wiki/Bilingual "Bilingual") teen. Zack's mother is sick, and he lives in fear that he will return home one day to find her dead.[16][17]
  * [Bill Hader](/wiki/Bill_Hader "Bill Hader") as the voice of [Alpha 5](/wiki/Mighty_Morphin_Power_Rangers "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"): The robot assistant to Zordon.[18][19]
  * [Bryan Cranston](/wiki/Bryan_Cranston "Bryan Cranston") as the voice of [Zordon](/wiki/Zordon "Zordon"): He is the Power Rangers' mentor and former Red Ranger. Zordon lived millions of years ago before his consciousness became a part of the Morphing Grid at the time of his death.[18][20]
  * [Elizabeth Banks](/wiki/Elizabeth_Banks "Elizabeth Banks") as [Rita Repulsa](/wiki/Rita_Repulsa "Rita Repulsa"):[18][21] a millions of years old, former Green Ranger who went rogue and killed her old team before being temporarily subdued by Zordon. She works to form the monster [Goldar](/wiki/Goldar "Goldar") while attempting to steal the [Zeo Crystal](/wiki/Zeo_Crystal "Zeo Crystal"), an artifact that channels the Morphing Grid, giving the Power Rangers their powers.[18]
  * [David Denman](/wiki/David_Denman "David Denman") as Sam Scott, Jason's father.[22]
  * [Caroline Cave](/wiki/Caroline_Cave "Caroline Cave") as Beverly Scott, Jason's mother.
  * [Anjali Jay](/wiki/Anjali_Jay "Anjali Jay") as Maddy Hart, Kimberly's mother.[23]
  * [Patrick Sabongui](/wiki/Patrick_Sabongui "Patrick Sabongui") as Trini's father.[24][25]
  * [Erica Cerra](/wiki/Erica_Cerra "Erica Cerra") as Trini's mother.
  * Kayden Magnuson as Pearl Scott, Jason's sister.
  * [Fiona Fu](/w/index.php?title=Fiona_Fu&action=edit&redlink=1 "Fiona Fu \(page does not exist\)") as Zack's mother.
  * [Sarah Grey](/wiki/Sarah_Grey "Sarah Grey") as Amanda Clark[26][27]
  * Emily Maddison as Rebecca[28][29][30]
  * [Wesley MacInnes](/wiki/Wesley_MacInnes "Wesley MacInnes") as Colt Wallace, a school bully who is constantly picking on Billy.
  * [Jaime Callica](/wiki/Jaime_Callica "Jaime Callica") as Officer Bebe[31]
  * [Matt Shively](/wiki/Matt_Shively "Matt Shively") as Damo
  * [Garry Chalk](/wiki/Garry_Chalk "Garry Chalk") as [Captain](/wiki/Police_captain "Police captain") Bowen
  * [Fred Tatasciore](/wiki/Fred_Tatasciore "Fred Tatasciore") as the voice of [Goldar](/wiki/Goldar "Goldar"), a gigantic winged monster made of gold. 
    * Tatasciore also provides the vocal effects of the [Putties](/wiki/Villains_in_Mighty_Morphin_Power_Rangers#Putty_Patrol "Villains in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers") who are depicted as stone [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem") that can be made from any Earth element.

[Jason David Frank](/wiki/Jason_David_Frank "Jason David Frank") and [Amy Jo
Johnson](/wiki/Amy_Jo_Johnson "Amy Jo Johnson"), two of the stars of the

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Production")]

###
Development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Development")]

[Saban Capital Group](/wiki/Saban_Capital_Group "Saban Capital Group") and
[Lionsgate](/wiki/Lionsgate "Lionsgate") announced the film in May 2014,[33]
with [Roberto Orci](/wiki/Roberto_Orci "Roberto Orci") originally attached to
produce. [Ashley Miller](/wiki/Ashley_Miller_\(screenwriter\) "Ashley Miller
\(screenwriter\)") and [Zack Stentz](/wiki/Zack_Stentz "Zack Stentz") were
hired to write the film's script.[34] Orci eventually left the project to work
on _[Star Trek Beyond](/wiki/Star_Trek_Beyond "Star Trek Beyond")_.[35] On
April 10, 2015, _[TheWrap](/wiki/TheWrap "TheWrap")_ reported that [Dean
Israelite](/wiki/Dean_Israelite "Dean Israelite") was in negotiations to
direct the film.[36] Israelite told IGN in an interview that the film would be
"completely playful, and it needs to be really fun and funny. But like
_[Project Almanac](/wiki/Project_Almanac "Project Almanac")_ , it's going to
feel very grounded at the same time, and very contemporary and have a real
edge to it, and a real gut to it, it's going to be a fun, joyful [movie] but
one that feels completely grounded in a real world, with real characters going
through real things".[37] [Brian Tyler](/wiki/Brian_Tyler "Brian Tyler") was
brought on to compose the film's music.[38] Israelite has said that the film
updates itself from the original series, being more character-driven and
incorporating naturalism and a grounded nature.[39]

###
Casting[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Casting")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Cast_of_the_Power_Rangers_movie_%28cropped%29.jpg/220px-
Cast_of_the_Power_Rangers_movie_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Cast_of_the_Power_Rangers_movie_\(cropped\).jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Cast_of_the_Power_Rangers_movie_\(cropped\).jpg "Enlarge")

The main cast discussion offsite at [Petco Park](/wiki/Petco_Park "Petco
Park") during [San Diego Comic-Con 2016](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego
Comic-Con"). From left: [Dacre Montgomery](/wiki/Dacre_Montgomery "Dacre
Montgomery"), [RJ Cyler](/wiki/RJ_Cyler "RJ Cyler"), [Naomi
Scott](/wiki/Naomi_Scott "Naomi Scott"), [Becky G](/wiki/Becky_G "Becky G")
and [Ludi Lin](/wiki/Ludi_Lin "Ludi Lin").

Actors began testing for the roles of the five Power Rangers on October 2,
2015.[40] On October 7, 2015, [Naomi Scott](/wiki/Naomi_Scott "Naomi Scott")
was cast as [Kimberly](/wiki/Kimberly_Hart "Kimberly Hart").[11] Newcomers
[Dacre Montgomery](/wiki/Dacre_Montgomery "Dacre Montgomery"), [Ludi
Lin](/wiki/Ludi_Lin "Ludi Lin") and [RJ Cyler](/wiki/RJ_Cyler "RJ Cyler") were
then cast as [Jason](/wiki/Jason_Lee_Scott "Jason Lee Scott"),[10]
[Zack](/wiki/Zack_Taylor "Zack Taylor"),[16] and [Billy](/wiki/Billy_Cranston
"Billy Cranston"), respectively.[13] At the month's end, [Becky
G](/wiki/Becky_G "Becky G") was chosen to play [Trini](/wiki/Trini_Kwan "Trini
Kwan").[14] When it came to casting the Rangers, director Dean Israelite said,
"From the very beginning, diversity was a very important part of the whole
process," and that while the characters' races were switched around, he added
that, "We made sure that the essence of each of those characters are who they
were in the original show, and this really will be an [origin
story](/wiki/Origin_story "Origin story") of those characters."[41] On
February 2, 2016, it was announced that [Elizabeth
Banks](/wiki/Elizabeth_Banks "Elizabeth Banks") would portray [Rita
Repulsa](/wiki/Rita_Repulsa "Rita Repulsa").[21] Four months later, [Bryan
Cranston](/wiki/Bryan_Cranston "Bryan Cranston"), who voiced Twin Man and
Snizard in the original series, announced he was cast as [Zordon](/wiki/Zordon
"Zordon").[20][42] Cranston revealed that he would perform motion-capture and
CGI.[42][43] In September 2016, [Walter Emanuel
Jones](/wiki/Walter_Emanuel_Jones "Walter Emanuel Jones"), the actor who
played Zack in the original series, stated none of the original cast would
[cameo](/wiki/Cameo_appearance "Cameo appearance") in the film.[44] Towards
the end of the month, comedian [Bill Hader](/wiki/Bill_Hader "Bill Hader") was
cast as [Alpha 5](/wiki/Alpha_5_\(Power_Rangers\) "Alpha 5 \(Power
Rangers\)").[19] In March 2017, it was reported that [Amy Jo
Johnson](/wiki/Amy_Jo_Johnson "Amy Jo Johnson") and [Jason David
Frank](/wiki/Jason_David_Frank "Jason David Frank"), who played Kimberly and
[Tommy](/wiki/Tommy_Oliver "Tommy Oliver") in the original series, would cameo
in the film, despite Jones' earlier comments.[32]

###
Filming[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Filming")]

Filming was originally set to begin in January 2016[45] but was rescheduled
and began on February 29 in [Vancouver](/wiki/Vancouver "Vancouver").[46][47]
On May 28, 2016, filming was complete.[48][49] Additional filming occurred in
October 2016.[50][51] A cast member claims that the film has broken the record
for the longest wire jump, but this has not been independently confirmed.[52]

The film was released in [Dolby Vision](/wiki/Dolby_Vision "Dolby Vision") and
[Dolby Atmos](/wiki/Dolby_Atmos "Dolby Atmos") sound.[53]

##
Marketing[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Marketing")]

On March 3, 2016, Lionsgate released the first official photo of the five
Rangers,[41] and the following month, the company released the first official
photo of Banks as Rita Repulsa.[21] On May 5, the company unveiled the first
official images of the Rangers' suits. Speaking of the suits, director Dean
Israelite said that "The show was about kids coming of age, about
metamorphosis, these suits needed to feel like they were catalyzed by these
kids and their energy, their spirit", while production designer Andrew Menzies
commented that the new suits are "an alien costume that grows on them, that’s
not man-made. You can’t win everyone over, but we are trying to appeal to a
more mature audience and gain new fans."[54] A teaser poster was released in
June,[55] with additional character posters released in July, September, and
October.[56][57][58] On October 8, 2016, a _Discover The Power_ teaser trailer
for the film was released.[59][60][61]

A fictional Angel Grove High School Newspaper website was created,[62]
alongside the official Power Rangers website, which features a GIF creator
that allows users to make a GIF out of scenes from the teaser trailer.[63][64]
There is also an official toyline, produced by [Bandai](/wiki/Bandai
"Bandai"),[65] and an extensive merchandising range was produced to promote
the film.[66]

[Max Landis](/wiki/Max_Landis "Max Landis"), who was fired from writing the
film, criticized the trailer, saying that it looked like
_[Chronicle](/wiki/Chronicle_\(2012_film\) "Chronicle \(2012 film\)")_ , a
film that he had written.[67] The trailer garnered mixed reactions, with some
praising it for its darker, contemporary reimagining of the classic
characters, while still looking action-packed and fun at the same
time,[68][69] and others criticizing it for its lack of connection to the
original series, saying it appeared "brooding".[70] The trailer received over
150 million views in the first two days after it was uploaded.[71] Lionsgate
revealed the T-Rex zord toy, among others, on October 28, 2016,[72] and the
Power Rangers Twitter account revealed the Megazord toy on November 4,
2016.[73] On November 15, 2016, Lionsgate revealed the toys based on the
film's individual Zords.[74]

On December 8, 2016, a new poster debuted, as well as a photo of Rita
Repulsa.[75][76] On December 19, 2016, Lionsgate and [Boom!
Studios](/wiki/Boom!_Studios "Boom! Studios") announced that they would
release a graphic novel titled _Power Rangers: Aftershock_ , set immediately
after the events of the movie.[77] An international trailer was released on
December 22, 2016.[78][79][80] [Qualcomm](/wiki/Qualcomm "Qualcomm") and
Lionsgate produced a virtual reality mobile app of the film _Power Rangers
Movie Command Center_ that was exhibited at the [CES
2017](/wiki/Consumer_Electronics_Show#2017 "Consumer Electronics Show"), from
January 5–8, 2017, [81] and was released in the App Store on March 8,
2017.[82] On January 19, a second trailer, titled _It’s Morphin Time!_ , was
released.[83][84][85] Lionsgate debuted yet another trailer, which it called
the _All-Star Trailer_ , on February 17.[86][87][88] New TV spots were
released on February 27, two about the Power Rangers,[89] and one about Rita
Repulsa.[90] A clip was released on March 6, followed by two more on March
9.[91][92][93] Thirty-seven stills were then released.[94] Another TV spot was
released on March 10.[95] In the final week before the movie premiered, two
more clips, as well as photos, were released.[96]

A [Build-A-Bear Workshop](/wiki/Build-A-Bear_Workshop "Build-A-Bear Workshop")
Power Ranger product range was announced on March 9, 2017.[97] [Krispy
Kreme](/wiki/Krispy_Kreme "Krispy Kreme") released doughnuts to promote the
film,[98] and served as an advertising partner.[99] Placement of Krispy Kreme
products and locations were featured in the film numerous times.[100]

The group collaborated with YouTube sports entertainment group [Dude
Perfect](/wiki/Dude_Perfect "Dude Perfect") ahead of the film's release, in a
video titled _Dude Perfect vs. Power Rangers_.[99]

### Video
game[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Video game")]

Further information: [Power Rangers: Legacy
Wars](/wiki/Power_Rangers:_Legacy_Wars "Power Rangers: Legacy Wars")

Lionsgate and Saban, in collaboration with [nWay Games](/wiki/ChronoBlade
"ChronoBlade"), released a [PvP](/wiki/Player_versus_player "Player versus
player") fighting [mobile game](/wiki/Mobile_game "Mobile game") called
_[Power Rangers: Legacy Wars](/wiki/Power_Rangers:_Legacy_Wars "Power Rangers:
Legacy Wars")_ on March 24, 2017, to coincide with the film's release.[101]
The game was featured on both Android and the Apple Store[102] and got to the
top spot on the [Apple App Store](/wiki/Apple_App_Store "Apple App Store") for
both [iPhones](/wiki/IPhone "IPhone") and [iPads](/wiki/IPads "IPads"),[103]
for two consecutive days and number two on the [Google Play
Store](/wiki/Google_Play_Store "Google Play Store").[102]

###
Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Music")]

The official soundtrack, with music by [Brian Tyler](/wiki/Brian_Tyler "Brian
Tyler"), was released digitally on March 24, 2017, and on CD on April 4,
distributed by [Varèse Sarabande](/wiki/Var%C3%A8se_Sarabande "Varèse
Sarabande").[104][105]

Power Rangers (Official Motion Picture Soundtrack)  
---  
[Soundtrack album](/wiki/Soundtrack_album "Soundtrack album") by [Brian

##
Release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Release")]

Originally scheduled for release on July 22, 2016,[106] Lionsgate delayed it
to March 24, 2017.[107] All five of the surviving members of the original cast
of the _Power Rangers_ series attended the film's Los Angeles premiere on
March 22, 2017.[108] It was the first time they had been together publicly
since 1995.[109]

### Box
office[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Box office")]

_Power Rangers_ grossed $85.4 million in the United States and Canada and
$56.7 million in other territories for a worldwide gross of $142 million,
against a production budget of $100 million.[3]

In the United States and Canada, _Power Rangers_ opened alongside
_[Life](/wiki/Life_\(2017_film\) "Life \(2017 film\)")_ ,
_[CHiPs](/wiki/CHiPs_\(film\) "CHiPs \(film\)")_ and
_[Wilson](/wiki/Wilson_\(2017_film\) "Wilson \(2017 film\)")_ , and was
projected to gross $30–35 million from 3,693 theaters on its opening
weekend.[110] The film made $3.6 million from Thursday night previews and $15
million on its first day.[111] It went on to debut to $40.3 million, finishing
second at the box office behind _[Beauty and the
Beast](/wiki/Beauty_and_the_Beast_\(2017_film\) "Beauty and the Beast \(2017
film\)")_ ($90.4 million).[112][113] The audience was notably diverse and
mostly 18-34 years old.[114] In its second weekend the film grossed $14.5
million (a drop of 64%), finishing 4th at the box office.[115][116][117] In
June 2017, Dean Israelite said that the film's PG-13 rating probably
contributed to the film's underperformance at the box office.[118]

### Critical
response[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: Critical response")]

_Power Rangers_ received mixed reviews from critics.[119][120][121] On [review
aggregator](/wiki/Review_aggregator "Review aggregator") website [Rotten
Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"), the film has an approval
rating of 45% based on 132 reviews, and an [average
rating](/wiki/Weighted_arithmetic_mean "Weighted arithmetic mean") of 5.1/10.
The site's critical consensus reads, "_Power Rangers_ has neither the campy
fun of its TV predecessor nor the blockbuster action of its cinematic
superhero competitors, and sadly never quite manages to shift into turbo for
some good old-fashioned morphin time."[122] On [Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic
"Metacritic"), which assigns a normalized rating, the film has a score 44 out
of 100, based on 30 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".[123]
Audiences polled by [CinemaScore](/wiki/CinemaScore "CinemaScore") gave the
film an average grade of "A" on an A+ to F scale.[124]

[IGN](/wiki/IGN "IGN") gave the film a 7/10, saying, "_Power Rangers_ doesn’t
quite pull off everything it wants to, but it’s a fun time at the theater
nonetheless."[125] Mike McCahill of _[The Guardian](/wiki/The_Guardian "The
Guardian")_ wrote that "the film achieves a functioning mediocrity we perhaps
might have thought beyond this franchise," and gave it 2 out of 5 stars.[126]

Mike Ryan of _[Uproxx](/wiki/Uproxx "Uproxx")_ gave the film a negative
review, writing: "_Power Rangers_ has one of the most zig-zagged tones of any
big budget studio film I’ve seen in a long time. It’s jarring at times how
often it goes back and forth between 'gritty' and 'silly'."[127] Writing for
_[Variety](/wiki/Variety_\(magazine\) "Variety \(magazine\)")_ , [Owen
Gleiberman](/wiki/Owen_Gleiberman "Owen Gleiberman") also criticized the
film's conflicting tones, saying: "...25 years ago, _Mighty Morphin Power
Rangers_ was launched as superhero fodder for kids, and there was indeed a
place for it, but we’re now so awash in superhero culture that kids no longer
need the safe, lame, pandering junior-league version of it. They can just
watch _[Ant-Man](/wiki/Ant-Man_\(film\) "Ant-Man \(film\)")_ or the PG-13
_[Suicide Squad](/wiki/Suicide_Squad_\(film\) "Suicide Squad \(film\)")_.
Safe, lame, and pandering have all grown up."[128] In a review for _[The
Telegraph](/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph "The Daily Telegraph")_ , Robbie Collin
gave it 1/5 stars, criticizing the "abjectly embarrassing frenzy of product
placement".[129]

### Home
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Home media")]

_Power Rangers_ was released on [Digital HD](/wiki/Digital_distribution
"Digital distribution") on June 13, 2017, and was followed by a release on
[Ultra HD](/wiki/Ultra_HD_Blu-ray "Ultra HD Blu-ray"), [Blu-ray](/wiki/Blu-ray
"Blu-ray") and [DVD](/wiki/DVD "DVD") on June 27, 2017[130] with retail
exclusive variants being made available at [Best Buy](/wiki/Best_Buy "Best
Buy"),[131] [Target](/wiki/Target_Corporation "Target Corporation") and [Wal-
Mart](/wiki/Wal-Mart "Wal-Mart"). The film debuted at the No. 1 spot on the
NPD VideoScan overall disc sales chart, which tracks combined DVD and Blu-ray
Disc sales; NPD’s dedicated Blu-ray Disc sales chart; and Home Media
Magazine’s video rental chart for the week ending July 2, 2017.[132] The film
retained the top spot on the NPD VideoScan’s overall disc sales chart for the
week ending on July 9, 2017.[133]

## Potential
sequels[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Power_Rangers_\(film\)&action=edit&section=15
"Edit section: Potential sequels")]

In a May 2016 [conference call](/wiki/Conference_call#Business "Conference
call") to analysts, Lionsgate CEO [Jon Feltheimer](/wiki/Jon_Feltheimer "Jon
Feltheimer") stated, "We could see doing five or six or seven."[137][138] On
March 22, 2017, [Haim Saban](/wiki/Haim_Saban "Haim Saban") said that he and
Lionsgate already have a six-film story arc.[139] However in May 2017,
_[Forbes](/wiki/Forbes "Forbes")_ noted that due to the underwhelming
performance of the film in most markets, it was unlikely any sequels would be
made.[7] Later that same month, it was reported that the sequels could still
be made thanks to record-breaking merchandise sales.[140] Prior to the home
release of the movie, Israelite confirmed that talks were taking place
regarding a sequel[141] and that he would like to include [Lord
Zedd](/wiki/Lord_Zedd "Lord Zedd") in it.[142] The possibility of a sequel
increased once more in early July 2017 when it was reported that the film held
the number one spot in home media sales and rentals in its first week.[143]
